alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 12:09PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Mill Creek Near Nolensville affecting Davidson County. For the Mill Creek...including Nolensville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mill Creek Near Nolensville. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to inundate low lying areas along the creek, including property near Bell Rd and Blue Hole Rd, and the athletic fields near Lighthouse Christian School. Water may also approach low lying areas near the Chandler Harris bridge on Nolensville Pike, including portions of Culbertson Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 11.9 feet and falling. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 615 AM CST.
